Platform.Title: MWG E. coli K12 Array
Platform.Description: 4239 E. coli K12 specific oligonucleotide probes represent the complete Escherichia coli (K12)genome.

Column.Name: metarow
Column.Description: number of subarray row

Column.Name: metacolumn
Column.Description: number of subarray column

Column.Name: row
Column.Description: number of row within subarray

Column.Name: column
Column.Description: number of column within subarray

Column.Name: oligo_name
Column.Description: MWG oligo id

Column.Name: description
Column.Description: gene description

Column.Name: ORF
Column.Description: Locus name

Column.Name: SPOT_ID
Column.Description: spot identifier

Sample.Title: Aerobic NO Chemostat Run 1

Channel.Source: Steady-state continuous cultured control aerobic samples in absence of NOC compounds.
Channel.Label: Cy3

Channel.Source: Steady-state continuous cultured aerobic experiment samples in presence of 10 uM each of NOC-5 and NOC-7 for 5 minutes
Channel.Label: Cy5

Sample.Description: Escherichia coli strain MG1655 was grown in a New Brunswick Scientific Bioflow III Biofermentor under continuous culture (chemostat) conditions. Cells were grown in defined media containing 8 mM glycerol as the sole and limiting source of energy and carbon. The working volume was 1 litre, and the dilution rate 0.1 h-1. For aerobic growth, the air-flow rate was 1 l/min, and the dissolved oxygen tension was maintained at 40% air saturation by measuring oxygen dissolved in the culture using a Broadley James D140 OxyProbe® electrode and automated adjustment of stirring rate. Cells were grown as above to steady-state, At steady-state, NOC-5 and NOC-7 was added to the chemostat culture and to the nutrient feed at a final concentration of 10 uM of each unless stated otherwise. Samples were taken immediately prior to the addition of NOCs and after a period of 5 min exposure to NOCs for subsequent analysis using microarrays. Cells were harvested directly into RNA Protect (Qiagen) to stabilize RNA, and total RNA was purified using Qiagen’s RNeasy Mini kit as recommended by the suppliers.
Sample.Data-Processing: background correction, log2 transformation and Loess normalisation performed using GeneSight 4.1 software, Copyright Biodiscovery.

Column.Name: VALUE
Column.Description: test:reference ratio following background correction, log2 transformation, Loess normalisation

Column.Name: CH1_MEAN
Column.Description: Mean data in Cy3 Channel

Column.Name: CH1_BKD_MEAN
Column.Description: Background Mean in Cy3 Channel

Column.Name: CH1_AREA
Column.Description: Spot Area in Cy3 Channel

Column.Name: CH1_BKD_AREA
Column.Description: Background Area in Cy3 Channel

Column.Name: CH1_RAW
Column.Description: Raw signal output data obtained from image analysis algorithm in Cy3 Channel

Column.Name: CH1_BKD_RAW
Column.Description: Raw background output data obtained from image analysis algorithm in Cy3 Channel

Column.Name: CH1_SD
Column.Description: Standard Deviation obtained in Cy3 Channel

Column.Name: CH1_BKD_SD
Column.Description: Background Standard Deviation in Cy3 Channel

Column.Name: CH2_MEAN
Column.Description: Mean data in Cy5 Channel

Column.Name: CH2_BKD_MEAN
Column.Description: Background Mean in Cy5 Channel

Column.Name: CH2_AREA
Column.Description: Spot Area in Cy5 Channel

Column.Name: CH2_BKD_AREA
Column.Description: Background Area in Cy5 Channel

Column.Name: CH2_RAW
Column.Description: Raw signal output data obtained from image analysis algorithm in Cy5 Channel

Column.Description: Raw background output data obtained from image analysis algorithm in Cy5 Channel

Column.Name: CH2_SD
Column.Description: Standard Deviation obtained in Cy5 Channel

Column.Name: CH2_BKD_SD
Column.Description: Background Standard Deviation in Cy5 Channel

Sample.Title: Anaerobic NO Chemostat Run 1

Channel.Source: Steady-state continuous cultured control anaerobic samples in absence of NOC compounds
Channel.Label: Cy3

Channel.Source: Steady-state continuous cultured anaerobic experiment samples in presence of 10 uM each of NOC-5 and NOC-7 for 5 minutes
Channel.Label: Cy5

Sample.Description: Escherichia coli strain MG1655 was grown in a New Brunswick Scientific Bioflow III Biofermentor under continuous culture (chemostat) conditions. Cells were grown in defined media containing 54 mM glycerol as the sole and limiting source of energy and carbon. The working volume was 1 litre, and the dilution rate 0.1 h-1. In order to establish anaerobic growth, nitrogen was sparged through the chemostat medium prior to inoculation and throughout the course of the experiment at a rate of 0.2 l/min. No dissolved oxygen was detectable using the OxyProbe. Sodium fumarate was added to anaerobic medium at a final concentration of 50 mM to act as a terminal electron acceptor. Cells were grown as above to steady-state, At steady-state, NOC-5 and NOC-7 were added to the chemostat culture and to the nutrient feed at a final concentration of 10 uM of each, unless otherwise stated. Samples were taken immediately prior to the addition of NOCs and after a period of 5 min exposure to NOC for subsequent analysis using microarrays. Cells were harvested directly into RNA Protect (Qiagen) to stabilize RNA, and total RNA was purified using Qiagen’s RNeasy Mini kit as recommended by the suppliers.
Sample.Data-Processing: background correction, log2 transformation and Loess normalisation were performed using Genesight 4.1 software, copyright BioDiscovery

Column.Name: VALUE
Column.Description: test:reference ratio following background correction, log2 transformation, Loess normalisation

Column.Name: CH1_MEAN
Column.Description: Mean data in Cy3 Channel

Column.Name: CH1_BKD_MEAN
Column.Description: Background Mean in Cy3 Channel

Column.Name: CH1_AREA
Column.Description: Spot Area in Cy3 Channel

Column.Name: CH1_BKD_AREA
Column.Description: Background Area in Cy3 Channel

Column.Name: CH1_RAW
Column.Description: Raw signal output data obtained from image analysis algorithm in Cy3 Channel

Column.Description: Raw background output data obtained from image analysis algorithm in Cy3 Channel

Column.Description: Standard Deviation obtained in Cy3 Channel

Column.Description: Background Standard Deviation in Cy3 Channel

Sample.Title: Anaerobic NO exposed Chemostat Comparison of Wt & norR mutant, Run 2

Channel.Source: anaerobic wild type experiment samples in presence of 10 uM each of NOC-5 and NOC-7 for 5 minutes
Channel.Label: Cy3

Channel.Source: anaerobic norR::Tn5 mutant experiment samples in presence of 10 uM each of NOC-5 and NOC-7 for 5 minutes
Channel.Label: Cy5

Sample.Description: Escherichia coli strains MG1655 and an isogenic norR::Tn5 mutant were grown in a New Brunswick Scientific Bioflow III Biofermentor under continuous culture (chemostat) conditions. Cells were grown in defined media containing 54 mM glycerol as the sole and limiting source of energy and carbon. The working volume was 1 litre, and the dilution rate 0.1 h-1. In order to establish anaerobic growth, nitrogen was sparged through the chemostat medium prior to inoculation and throughout the course of the experiment at a rate of 0.2 l/min. No dissolved oxygen was detectable using the OxyProbe. Sodium fumarate was added at a final concentration of 50 mM to act as a terminal electron acceptor. Cells were grown as above to steady-state, At steady-state, NOC-5 and NOC-7 were added to the chemostat culture and to the nutrient feed at a final concentration of 10 uM of each. Samples were taken after a period of 5 min exposure to NOC for subsequent analysis using microarrays. Cells were harvested directly into RNA Protect (Qiagen) to stabilize RNA, and total RNA was purified using Qiagen’s RNeasy Mini kit as recommended by the suppliers.
Sample.Data-Processing: background correction, log2 transformation and Loess normalisation were performed using Genesight 4.1 software, copyright BioDiscovery

Column.Description: test:reference ratio following background correction, log2 transformation, Loess normalisation

Sample.Title: Aerobic NO exposed Chemostat Comparison of Wt & norR mutant, Run 1

Channel.Source: Aerobic wild type experiment samples in presence of 10 uM each of NOC-5 and NOC-7 for 5 minutes
Channel.Label: Cy3

Channel.Source: Aerobic norR::Tn5 mutant experiment samples in presence of 10 uM each of NOC-5 and NOC-7 for 5 minutes
Channel.Label: Cy5

Sample.Description: Escherichia coli strains MG1655 and an isogenic norR::Tn5 mutant were grown in a New Brunswick Scientific Bioflow III Biofermentor under continuous culture (chemostat) conditions.. Cells were grown in defined media containing 8 mM glycerol as the sole and limiting source of energy and carbon. The working volume was 1 litre, and the dilution rate 0.1 h-1. For aerobic growth, the air-flow rate was 1 l/min, and the dissolved oxygen tension was maintained at 40% air saturation by measuring oxygen dissolved in the culture using a Broadley James D140 OxyProbe® electrode and automated adjustment of stirring rate. Cells were grown as above to steady-state, At steady-state, NOC-5 and NOC-7 was added to the chemostat culture and to the nutrient feed at a final concentration of 10 uM of each unless stated otherwise. Samples were taken after a period of 5 min exposure to NOC for subsequent analysis using microarrays. Cells were harvested directly into RNA Protect (Qiagen) to stabilize RNA, and total RNA was purified using Qiagen’s RNeasy Mini kit as recommended by the suppliers.
Sample.Data-Processing: background correction, log2 transformation and Loess normalisation were performed using Genesight 4.1 software, copyright BioDiscovery

Column.Description: test:reference ratio following background correction, log2 transformation, Loess normalisation

Sample.Title: Aerobic NO exposed Chemostat Comparison of Wt & hmp mutant, Run 2 dye swap

Channel.Source: Aerobic hmp::Tn5 mutant experiment samples in presence of 10 uM each of NOC-5 and NOC-7 for 5 minutes
Channel.Label: Cy3

Channel.Source: Aerobic wild type experiment samples in presence of 10 uM each of NOC-5 and NOC-7 for 5 minutes
Channel.Label: Cy5

Sample.Description: Escherichia coli strains MG1655 and an isogenic hmp::Tn5 mutant were grown in a New Brunswick Scientific Bioflow III Biofermentor under continuous culture (chemostat) conditions.. Cells were grown in defined media containing 8 mM glycerol as the sole and limiting source of energy and carbon. The working volume was 1 litre, and the dilution rate 0.1 h-1. For aerobic growth, the air-flow rate was 1 l/min, and the dissolved oxygen tension was maintained at 40% air saturation by measuring oxygen dissolved in the culture using a Broadley James D140 OxyProbe® electrode and automated adjustment of stirring rate. Cells were grown as above to steady-state, At steady-state, NOC-5 and NOC-7 was added to the chemostat culture and to the nutrient feed at a final concentration of 10 uM of each unless stated otherwise. Samples were taken after a period of 5 min exposure to NOC for subsequent analysis using microarrays. Cells were harvested directly into RNA Protect (Qiagen) to stabilize RNA, and total RNA was purified using Qiagen’s RNeasy Mini kit as recommended by the suppliers.
Sample.Data-Processing: background correction, log2 transformation and Loess normalisation were performed using Genesight 4.1 software, copyright BioDiscovery

Column.Name: VALUE
Column.Description: test:reference ratio following background correction, log2 transformation, Loess normalisation

Series.Title: Aerobic and anaerobic transcriptional responses of wild type, hmp and norR to strains to NO in a chemostat
Series.Summary: This SuperSeries is composed of the following subset Series: GSE5075: Aerobic transcriptional responses of Escherichia coli to NO under defined chemostat conditions. GSE5076: Anaerobic transcriptional responses of Escherichia coli to NO under defined chemostat conditions. GSE5084: Anaerobic NO-exposed Chemostat Comparison of Wt & norR mutant Responses GSE5137: Aerobic NO-exposed Chemostat Comparison of Wt & norR mutant Responses GSE5139: Aerobic NO-exposed Chemostat Comparison of Wt & hmp mutant Responses Keywords: SuperSeries
